Health Assessment Questionnaire cited 03-Nov-2016 https://www.google.co.uk/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=4&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwjtqvS70ozQAhXlCcAKHb7cBE0QFghHMAM&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww2.gov.bc.ca%2Fassets%2Fgov%2Fhealth%2Fforms%2F5383fil.pdf&usg=AFQjCNFj2qNv5TNwHHL2R__lOQ4urvaX0g&sig2=hqc8K_Mvhd-HaxR4DWi4MA&bvm=bv.137132246,d.d2s
Health Assessment Questionnaire Instructions cited 03-Nov-2016 https://www.google.co.uk/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=1&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwjtqvS70ozQAhXlCcAKHb7cBE0QFgg0MAA&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.niehs.nih.gov%2Fresearch%2Fresources%2Fassets%2Fdocs%2Fhaq_instructions_508.pdf&usg=AFQjCNGhSSKJSp4BDsa7KiYNi5QWnT7Tlw&sig2=PfcquJirKTB7M4-xhqwr0Q

details.purpose: For the recording of details of the Health Assessment Questionnaire used to assess how a subject's arthritis affects his or her ability to function in daily life.
details.use: To record the details of the Health Assessment Questionnaire used in Rare Diseases management settings to assess how a subject's arthritis affects his or her ability to function in daily life.

items.items: The Health Assessment Questionnaire for arthritis.
A specific date and/or time which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
Assessment of subject's ability to dress, including tying shoelaces and doing buttons.
Assessment of the subject's ability to shampoo his or her hair.
Assessment of subject's ability to perform functions related to dressing and grooming.
The subject is able to dress without any difficulty.
The subject is able to dress with some difficulty.
The subject is able to dress with much difficulty.
The subject is unable to dress.
The subject is able to shampoo his or her hair without any difficulty.
The subject is able to shampoo his or her hair with some difficulty.
The subject is able to shampoo his or her hair with much difficulty.
The subject is unable to shampoo his or her hair.
Assessment of the subject's ability to stand up from low chair or floor or get in and out of bed.
Assessment of subject's ability to stand up from low chair or floor.
The subject is able to stand up from low chair or floor without any difficulty.
The subject is able to stand up from low chair or floor with some difficulty.
The subject is able to stand up from low chair or floor with much difficulty.
The subject is unable to stand up from low chair or floor.
Get in and out of bed
Assessment of the subject's ability to get in and out of bed.
The subject is able to get in and out of bed without any difficulty.
The subject is able to get in and out of bed with some difficulty.
The subject is able to get in and out of bed with much difficulty.
The subject is unable to get in and out of bed .
Assessment of the subject's ability to perform functions related to eating.
Assessment of the subject's ability to cut his or her own meat.
The subject is able to cut his or her own meat without any difficulty.
The subject is able to cut his or her own meat with some difficulty.
The subject is able to cut his or her own meat with much difficulty.
The subject is unable to cut his or her own meat.
Lift up cup or glass to mouth
Assessment of the subject's ability to lift a full cup or glass to mouth.
The subject is able to lift a cup or glass to mouth without any difficulty.
The subject is able to lift a cup or glass to mouth with some difficulty.
The subject is able to lift a cup or glass to mouth with much difficulty.
The subject is unable to lift a cup or glass to mouth.
Assessment of the subject's ability to open a new carton of milk.
The subject is able to open a new carton of milk without any difficulty.
The subject is able to open a new carton of milk with some difficulty.
The subject is able to open a new carton of milk with much difficulty.
The subject is unable to open a new carton of milk.
Assessment of the subject's ability to perform functions related to walking.
Assessment of the subject's ability to walk outdoors on flat ground.
The subject is able to walk outdoors on flat ground without any difficulty.
The subject is able to walk outdoors on flat ground with some difficulty.
The subject is able to walk outdoors on flat ground with much difficulty.
The subject is unable to walk outdoors on flat ground.
Assessment of the subject's ability to climb up five steps.
The subject is able to climb up five steps without any difficulty.
The subject is able to climb up five steps with some difficulty.
The subject is able to climb up five steps with much difficulty.
The subject is unable to climb up five steps.
Assessment of the subject's ability to perform functions related to hygiene.
Assessment of the subject's ability to wash and dry entire body.
The subject is able to wash and dry his or her entire body without any difficulty.
The subject is able to wash and dry his or her entire body with some difficulty.
The subject is able to wash and dry his or her entire body with much difficulty.
The subject is unable to wash and dry his or her entire body.
Assessment of the subject's ability to take a tub bath including getting in and out of the tub).
The subject is able to take a tub bath without any difficulty.
The subject is able to take a tub bath with some difficulty.
Assessment of the subject's ability to get on and off the toilet or potty chair.
The subject is able to take a tub bath with much difficulty.
The subject is unable to take a tub bath.
The subject is able to get on and off toilet or potty chair without any difficulty.
The subject is able to get on and off toilet or potty chair with some difficulty.
The subject is able to get on and off toilet or potty chair with much difficulty.
The subject is unable to get on and off toilet or potty chair.
Assessment of the subject's ability to perform functions related to reaching.
Assessment of the subject's ability to reach and get down a 5lb object from just above his/her head.
The subject is able to reach and get down a 5lb object from just above his/her head without any difficulty.
The subject is able to reach and get down a 5lb object from just above his/her head with some difficulty.
The subject is able to reach and get down a 5lb object from just above his/her head with much difficulty.
The subject is unable to reach and get down a 5lb object from just above his/her head.
Assessment of the subject's ability to bend down to pick up clothing or a piece of paper from the floor.
The subject is able to bend down to pick up clothing or a piece of paper from the floor without any difficulty.
The subject is able to bend down to pick up clothing or a piece of paper from the floor with some difficulty.
The subject is able to bend down to pick up clothing or a piece of paper from the floor with much difficulty.
The subject is unable to bend down to pick up clothing or a piece of paper from the floor.
Assessment of the subject's ability to perform functions relating to gripping or handling.
Assessment of the subject's ability to open car doors.
The subject is able to open car doors without any difficulty.
The subject is able to open car doors with some difficulty.
The subject is able to open car doors with much difficulty.
The subject is unable to open car doors.
Assessment of subject's ability to open jars that have been previously opened.
The subject is able to open jars that have been previously opened without any difficulty.
The subject is able to open jars that have been previously opened with some difficulty.
The subject is able to open jars that have been previously opened with much difficulty.
The subject is unable to open jars that have been previously opened.
Assessment of subject's ability to turn taps on and off.
The subject is able to turn taps on and off without any difficulty.
The subject is able to turn taps on and off with some difficulty.
The subject is able to turn taps on and off with much difficulty.
The subject is unable to turn taps on and off.
Assessment of the subject's ability to perform general activities.
Assessment of the subject's ability to run errands and shop.
The subject is able to run errands and shop without any difficulty.
Get in and out of car
Assessment of the subject's ability to get in and out of a car.
The subject is able to run errands and shop with some difficulty.
The subject is able to run errands and shop with much difficulty.
The subject is unable to run errands and shop.
The subject is able to get in and out of car without any difficulty.
The subject is able to get in and out of car with some difficulty.
The subject is able to get in and out of car with much difficulty.
The subject is unable to get in and out of car.
Assessment of the subject's ability to do household chores (e.g. wash dishes, take out trash, vacuuming, yardwork, make bed, clean room).
The subject is able to do household chores without any difficulty.
The subject is able to do household chores with some difficulty.
The subject is able to do household chores with much difficulty.
The subject is unable to do household chores.
Statement about the aids or devices usually used by the subject for hygiene, reach, grip and activities.
The subject usually uses a raised toilet seat.
The subject usually uses a bath seat.
The subject usually uses a jar opener for jars that have been previously opened.
The subject usually uses a bath rail.
The subject usually uses long-handled appliances for reach.
Statement of which activity categories (hygiene, reach, gripping and opening and errands and chores) usually require help for the subject from another person because of the subject's illness.
The subject usually needs help from another person for hygiene because of his or her illness.
The subject usually needs help from another person for reaching because of his or her illness.
The subject usually needs help from another person for gripping and opening things because of his or her illness.
The subject usually needs help from another person for errands and chores because of his or her illness.
Rating of how much pain the subject has had because of his/her illness in the past week on a scale of 0 (no pain) to 100 (very severe pain).
The subject usually uses a walker.
The subject usualy uses a wheelchair or scooter.
The subject usually uses special or built-up utensils.
The subject usually uses a special or built-up chair.
The subject usually needs help from another person for dressing and grooming because of his or her illness.
The subject usually needs help from another person for eating because of his or her illness.
The subject usually needs help from another person for walking because of his or her illness.
The subject usually needs help from another person for rising because of his or her illness.
Record any issues or factors that may impact on the assessment.
Additional information required to capture local context or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
e.g. Local hospital departmental infomation or additional metadata to align with HL7 or CDISC equivalents.
Narrative description of overall assessment by the subject.
